title: Is Raspbian for the Raspberry Pi 2 B 32-bit or a 64-bit OS? - Quora

response.answer_text: Raspbian is a 32 bit OS and liable to stay that way. The main benefit of a 64 bit OS is addressing more than 4GB RAM and the Pi 4 caps out at 4GB. You then need to take into account the Raspberry Pi Foundation’s mission of providing a cheap computer that school children can develop IT skills on. I repeat the target audience for the Raspberry Pi is schoolchildren and it makes sense for them to direct support at the 25 million + Raspberry Pi computers already sold (most of which are 32bit) than to split their resources to provide 32 and 64 bit Raspbian versions

I found this easy way of determining if your Linux based OS is 32 or 64 bit here Is raspbian for the Raspberry Pi 2 B 32 bit or a 64 bit OS? You only need to type the below command in your Raspberry Pi’s terminal to determine whether your Raspberry Pi Operating System is a 32 or 64 bit. getconf LONG_BIT I tried it on my Raspberry Pi 4 B and from the snapshot below it is evident that it is a 32 bit OS.
